events.originalText: An arson attack at the studio of Kyoto Animation in Japan led to the deaths of 36 people.
events.subtitle: Kyoto Animation arson attack
events.headline: Arson attack at Kyoto Animation studio in Japan kills 36

events.originalText: The conviction of former Italian prime minister Silvio Berlusconi, who had been found guilty of paying for an underage prostitute, was overturned on appeal.
events.subtitle: Silvio Berlusconi
events.headline: Conviction of former Italian PM Berlusconi overturned on appeal

events.originalText: A suicide bomber attacked an Israeli tour bus at Burgas Airport, Bulgaria, resulting in the military branch of Hezbollah being designated a terrorist organization by the European Union.
events.subtitle: 2012 Burgas bus bombing
events.headline: Suicide bomber targets Israeli tour bus in Bulgaria, Hezbollah labeled terrorist

events.originalText: Selena's album Dreaming of You, instrumental in popularizing Tejano music, was released posthumously.
events.subtitle: Selena
events.headline: Selena's posthumous album Dreaming of You boosts Tejano music

events.originalText: American actress Rebecca Schaeffer was shot and killed by Robert John Bardo, eventually prompting the passage of anti-stalking laws in California.
events.subtitle: Rebecca Schaeffer
events.headline: Actress Rebecca Schaeffer killed, prompting anti-stalking laws in California

events.originalText: Parts of the dismembered body of Swedish prostitute Catrine da Costa were found in Stockholm.
events.subtitle: Murder of Catrine da Costa
events.headline: Body parts of Swedish prostitute Catrine da Costa found in Stockholm

events.originalText: A gunman massacred 21 people and injured 15 others at a McDonald's restaurant in the San Ysidro section of San Diego, California.
events.subtitle: San Ysidro McDonald's massacre
events.headline: Gunman massacres 21 at McDonald's in San Ysidro, California

events.originalText: At the Olympic Games in Montreal, Nadia Comăneci (pictured) became the first person to score a perfect 10 in a modern Olympics gymnastics event.
events.subtitle: 1976 Summer Olympics
events.headline: Nadia Comăneci scores perfect 10 at Montreal Olympics

events.originalText: Angered by racism and poverty, African American residents of the Hough neighborhood of Cleveland began to riot for six days.
events.subtitle: Racism in the United States
events.headline: Hough neighborhood residents riot in Cleveland over racism and poverty

events.originalText: Francisco Javier Arana, the chief of the Guatemalan armed forces, was killed in a shootout with supporters of President Juan José Arévalo.
events.subtitle: Francisco Javier Arana
events.headline: Guatemalan armed forces chief killed in shootout with President's supporters

events.originalText: Nationalist rebels attempted a coup against the Second Spanish Republic, sparking the Spanish Civil War.
events.subtitle: Nationalist faction (Spanish Civil War)
events.headline: Nationalist rebels attempt coup against Second Spanish Republic, sparking Civil War

events.originalText: American Civil War: Led by Colonel Robert Gould Shaw, the 54th Massachusetts Infantry Regiment, one of the first African-American military units in the Union Army, spearheaded an assault (pictured) on Fort Wagner, South Carolina.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: 54th Massachusetts Infantry Regiment leads assault on Fort Wagner in Civil War

events.originalText: Pedro II, the last emperor of Brazil, was crowned (depicted) at the Old Cathedral of Rio de Janeiro.
events.subtitle: Pedro II of Brazil
events.headline: Last emperor of Brazil, Pedro II, crowned at Old Cathedral of Rio de Janeiro

events.originalText: A gunpowder magazine explosion in Birgu, Malta, killed an estimated 200 people.
events.subtitle: 1806 Birgu polverista explosion
events.headline: Gunpowder magazine explosion in Birgu, Malta kills 200

events.originalText: Johann Sebastian Bach directed the first performance of his cantata Erforsche mich, Gott, und erfahre mein Herz in Leipzig.
events.subtitle: Johann Sebastian Bach
events.headline: Bach directs first performance of cantata Erforsche mich, Gott, und erfahre mein Herz

events.originalText: King Edward I issued an edict to expel all Jews from England.
events.subtitle: Edward I of England
events.headline: King Edward I issues edict to expel all Jews from England
